node.title: After ‘Mist,’ They Saw Things Differently
node.description: An evening at Mist Harlem, a former restaurant and bar, propelled Walter Smith-Randolph and LeAnne Armstead’s 12-year friendship into something more.
node.content: ["Walter Smith-Randolph said he was interested in LeAnne Armstead from the moment he met her at a 2005 barbecue hosted by Villanova University\u2019s Black Cultural Society.", "But it was a long, long, long time before anything came of it.", "\u201cI was 12 years a friend,\u201d he said.", "The two became friendly, a little closer than acquaintances, Ms. Armstead said, but not best friends either. They\u2019d hang out with people in their social circle regularly, and they had a class together. Mr. Smith-Randolph, 34, had a car while in school, and recalled picking up Ms. Armstead, 35, from her family home in Brooklyn when driving back to college from his own family home in Queens Village, Queens. (\u201cShe says it only happened twice,\u201d he said.)", "He never made a move, though.", "\u201cShe was beautiful, tall, gorgeous, and I thought that she was out of my league,\u201d he said.", "After both graduated \u2014 she in 2008, he in 2009 \u2014 they continued to see each other sporadically. When Mr. Smith-Randolph, who received a master\u2019s degree in journalism from the City University of New York, later moved to Elmira, N.Y., for his first job in broadcasting, Ms. Armstead and another friend visited him there.", "The two also often met up, with other people, in New York for \u201cgame watches,\u201d which are essentially informal alumni reunions on the occasion of Villanova basketball games.", "Ms. Armstead said that in November 2017, when Mr. Smith-Randolph had traveled from Kalamazoo, Mich., where he was then working, to New York for a family event, something changed.", "They made plans to meet up at Mist Harlem, which was then a bar, restaurant and event space. She was attending with a group of friends, but the two still ended up making a quasi-solo evening of it.", "\u201cMy girlfriends were asking me, \u2018How come you\u2019re not dating him?\u2019\u201d Ms. Armstead said. She responded, \u201cHe\u2019s a catch, but I don\u2019t want to mess up a friendship.\u201d", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "The evening did get her thinking, though. She texted Mr. Smith-Randolph, who flew back to Michigan right after their meet-up, later that night to make sure that he had gotten home safe. In her mind, she was indicating to him that she was thinking about him more than casually.", "Mr. Smith-Randolph remembers a little less subtlety in the course of the evening.", "\u201cWhen we started talking one on one, she grabbed my thigh,\u201d said Mr. Smith-Randolph, who is now the investigative editor at Connecticut Public Broadcasting in Hartford. \u201cI was like, Oh wow, this is something.\u201d", "The two commenced texting every day, \u201cabout the most minute things,\u201d said Ms. Armstead, now an e-commerce marketing manager at the Kroger Company, a grocery and retailer. When Mr. Smith-Randolph returned to New York the next month, both anticipated that their relationship might evolve.", "They had brunch together the day before New Year\u2019s Eve and, Ms. Armstead said, \u201cWe were being kind of flirty, kind of touching hands.\u201d", "As they headed back to her apartment, she remembers, \u201cHe said, You know, you\u2019re going to be my wife.\u201d", "But first, she became his girlfriend. On Dec. 31, 2017, Ms. Armstead said, \u201cHe asked me to be his girlfriend. And then we had our first kiss.\u201d They dated for more than two years before becoming engaged in May 2020.", "The couple, who will both use the surname Randolph and who now live in New Haven, Conn., married Nov. 6 at St. Thomas of Villanova Roman Catholic Church on the campus of their alma mater. The Rev. Peter M. Donohue, who is the university\u2019s president, performed the ceremony before 160 guests, all vaccinated against the coronavirus.", "Of the yearslong friend who became his wife, Mr. Smith-Randolph said, \u201cShe\u2019s one of my biggest supporters, she holds me accountable and she\u2019s loyal. Even when you\u2019re messing up, she\u2019s not going to abandon you or run out on you. She\u2019s going to stick with you through it. And she\u2019s gorgeous.\u201d"]
